definitions: To impale on a sharp point.
To add alcohol or drugs to a drink or food surreptitiously.
To reject or stop something abruptly.
To hit a volleyball forcefully downwards over the net.
To provide with spikes or sharp projections.
examples: The fence was spiked with sharp iron.
Someone spiked her drink at the party.
The editor spiked the controversial article.
She spiked the ball for the winning point.
The shoes were spiked for better grip.
